subject: Hello Dearest,
body:
Hello Dearest,
My name is James Mordi, special assistance to Ahmed Ali Gulak the former Special Adviser (Politics) to President Goodluck Jonathan, who was killed by unknown gunmen in Owerri, Imo State on Sunday,30 May 2021.May his soul rest in peace. The essence of this message is to reveal the secret which i had with my boss before his demise but i beg for your understanding.
My Boss deposited the sum of Ten Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars in Vystar Credit Union a bank in America for investment purposes before his untimely death. As we cannot lay hands on the funds presently because of fear of government confiscation of the money, the bank manager has secretly instructed me to present a foreigner who will stand as a trustee partner to my late Boss or next of kin in order to transfer this money to him/her for safe keeping and investment purposes. You can invest this money in real estate or any profitable venture of your choice where I will have a fair share of the money.
Please indicate your interest by replying to me so that adequate modalities will be put in place for you to receive this money.
I will be happy to get your response urgently as it is needed.
Yours Sincerely,
James Mordi.

subject: Re:  Hello Dearest,
body:
Hello James Mordi,

Thank you for reaching out to me with this opportunity. I'm sorry to hear about the unfortunate passing of your boss. The offer you mentioned sounds interesting, but I have a few questions before proceeding. Could you please provide more details about the process of becoming a trustee partner? How long does it usually take for the funds to be transferred? And are there any legal requirements or fees involved in this transaction?

I appreciate your prompt response.

Best wishes,
Judith

subject: THANKS FOR YOUR GOOD RESPONSE
body:
*Dear Judith,I hereby acknowledge your prompt response to my message and in
the same vain i am assuring you that every legitimate means will be used to
ensure that this money gets to you without any hitch.You are to send to me
without delay the below information of yours which I will use to draft a
referral letter of introduction to the bank so that the executive
management would know that you are the next of kin/trustee partner to their
late depositor Ahmed Ali Gulak.The required information:-Your full
names:Your contact home address/Country:Your telephone number:Photocopy of
your identification card or int'l passport:As soon as you comply with these
directives, i will let the bank know that you are ready for the claim of
this money also i will give you the name of the bank director which you
will contact.For your understanding 40% percent of the US$10.5 Million goes
to your pocket alone while 60% will be for the investment purposes under
your care.Concerning your question about fees, i don't think much would be
needed but in case of fees i suggest we shall jointly handle it kindly to
ensure that the funds are released to us.Immediately you have received this
money in account you are to minus all that you have spent from the 60%
mapped out for the investment and invest the balance in real estate or any
profitable venture of your choice.Please do not be scared about the token
that may be required for we shall benefit hugely from this good business
and build further business relationship.Again thank you for your
understanding and looking forward to seeing your total compliance.Yours
Sincerely,James Mordi.*

subject: Re: THANKS FOR YOUR GOOD RESPONSE
body:
Dear Mordi,

Thank you for your prompt response. I appreciate your assurance that every legitimate means will be used to ensure the safe transfer of the money. However, before we proceed, I have a few questions.

Firstly, could you please provide more details about the late depositor Ahmed Ali? How did he acquire such a large sum of money? And why was he unable to claim it himself?

Secondly, you mentioned that I would need to provide my card or international passport. Why is this necessary for the bank's referral letter? Is there any other documentation that would be required?

Lastly, you mentioned that there might be some fees involved. Could you please clarify what these fees are for and how much they would amount to? It's important for me to understand all the financial aspects before moving forward.

I look forward to your response and further information.

Best wishes,
Judith

subject: THANKS FOR YOUR SWIFT RESPONSE
body:
*Dear Judith,Thanks for your swift response,however i still see you digging
dip for understanding which is not bad.Briefly about Ahmed Ali Gulak:A
former political adviser to ex-Nigeria President Goodluck Jonathan.Former
Special Adviser on Politics to the then President, Goodluck Jonathan. He
was a chieftain of All Progressive Party APC,Ahmed Ali Gulak was born in
Adamawa State,Nigeria.In september 30th 2021 Ahmed Ali Gulak was shot dead
by unknown gunmen in Imo State.He was a lawyer by profession and a
successful politician in Nigeria.Please you can verify from other sources
if you wish.He made his money through politics like other politicians in
Nigeria. Why he did not claim this money before his death is best known to
him, beside he was assassinated.Photocopy of your identification card or
int'l passport is for bank to know that you are the right person that this
money will go to and it is the bank that would mention the documents if any
would be needed.The fee i guest here is processing fees which may not be
more than US$2000.00 but the bank has not mentioned any fees for now.I
suggest we get to the bank first and know their requirements as you are
skeptical then if it is not what you can bear then i can look for a way out
but i am only asking you to be courageous for us to seal this deal and have
our money,please fearless.Again thank you for your understanding and good
response again.Yours Sincerely,James Mordi.*

subject: Re: THANKS FOR YOUR SWIFT RESPONSE
body:
Dear Mordi,

Thank you for reaching out to me with this information about Ahmed Ali Gulak. It's unfortunate to hear about his passing. I understand that he was a successful politician and lawyer in Nigeria.

I'm curious to know more about the money you mentioned. Can you provide some details on how much money is involved and why it needs to be claimed? Also, could you explain why the bank would require my card or international passport?

I appreciate your suggestion of contacting the bank directly to gather more information. Before we proceed, could you please clarify if there are any fees associated with this process? I just want to make sure I have all the necessary information before making any decisions.

Thank you again for sharing this with me, Mordi. I look forward to hearing back from you soon.

Best wishes,
Judith

subject: PLEASE MAKE YOUR DECISION KNOWN
body:
Dear Judith,

Your last response has been received with repeated content therin.I think i
have answered the repeated questions in my previous message, well i can
understand that you are a careful person.

Again answering your question,Photocopy of your identification card or
int'l passport is for the bank to know that you are the right person that
would receive this money.I believe this is for official purposes or do you
think is not necessary for a bank to demand means of identification of
funds beneficiary?Bank will handle this transaction legitimately as a
financial institution. A bank may ask for passport details as part of its
customer due diligence process, which is the process of verifying the
identity of its customers.

By collecting passport details, the bank can verify the identity of its
customers, ensuring that they are who they claim to be. The passport
information helps the bank to match the customer's identity with
government-issued identification, which provides a high degree of
confidence that the customer is not involved in any illegal activities.
Additionally, passport information helps the bank to comply with the
requirements of international sanctions and to prevent transactions with
individuals and entities that are on sanctions lists.

The money involved is US$10.5 million and there is no fees require in
contacting the bank, it is free.If there is any fee required by the bank
while discharging their remittance duties they will explain it better.What
you are asking again is what i have cleared in my last message but you are
a careful person. On that note if inclusion of Photocopy of your
identification card or int'l passport is your fear then skip it and send
others to me.Lastly i'm of convision that you have nothing to lose
concerning this deal.

Let me know if you really want to contact the paying bank or not.Looking
forward to seeing you coming up with a favourable decision.

Yours Sincerely,
James Mordi.

subject: Re: PLEASE MAKE YOUR DECISION KNOWN
body:
Dear James Mordi,

Thank you for your response. I appreciate your explanation regarding the need for passport details by the bank. It makes sense that they would want to verify the identity of their customers to prevent any illegal activities.

You mentioned that there are no fees required in contacting the bank, but what about any fees involved in the remittance process? Could you please clarify if there will be any charges or expenses that I need to be aware of?

Also, I understand your suggestion to skip including a photocopy of my card or international passport if it is a concern. However, are there any alternative ways to verify my identity that the bank would accept?

I'm still considering whether or not to proceed with this opportunity, but I appreciate your patience and willingness to provide further information.

Best wishes,
Judith

subject: PLEASE MAKE YOUR DECISION KNOWN
body:
*Dear Judith,Thank you for writing again and signifying that you are at the
valley of decision, however i pray that you will come out so confident in
proceeding with this opportunity.Now going straight to your question about
fees."If there would be fees in the course of remittance it will be the
bank that will explain it"I mean that the bank is in a better position to
give us conditions or terms whether fees are needed or not. In my previous

will not exceed US$2000 but we have to wait and hear from the bank first.*








*Please my sister let us be looking at the doughnut not the hole.At the end

if you are not willing to render this assistance, tell me maybe I will look

body:

body:

subject: WE ARE GOOD TO GO PLEASE
body:
*Dear Judith,Thanks for your precise response once again and i believe we
are making progress.You have laid much emphasis on your identity protection
which is right because no right thinking person will like his identity to
be at stake.Please take it from me that this particular online facility
will give you a very strong identity protection coverage. I mean nobody
will damble into your identity. I hold the bank in high esteem.Online
banking works through a banking system that connects your bank account to a
secure website, or online banking web of a particular bank. You register as
a user and create a unique username and password to gain access to your
accounts, which the bank links to you alone and no one will have access to
your information.Through this access you will be making transfers to you
various bank accounts and commercial transactions without interference.  I
am not trying to impress you rather this is the veracity of the whole thing
that your identity is secured. In general, the bank transfer time will be
within five working days.This depends on factors like time zone and
currencies etc.Finally my sister, we are good to go at this jointure and
please have a good rest of mind.*



*Yours Sincerely,James Mordi.*

subject: Re: YOU HAVE TAKEN MUCH TIME
body:
Dear ,

Thank you for reaching out to me again. I appreciate your patience in explaining the situation further. I understand that the bank will provide more information about any potential fees involved in the remittance process. It's good to know that even if there are fees, they won't exceed a certain amount.

I also appreciate your assurance that my identity will be secured if I decide to proceed with this encryption technology used by the bank. I'm not majoring in banking, but I believe banks have firewalls or hardwires in place to prevent hackers from gaining access to their customers' data and accounts.

I understand that you want me to be patient and trust the process, as you don't want this money to end up in the government treasury as unclaimed funds. However, I would like to ask a few more questions before making any decisions.

Can you please explain how exactly this encryption technology works? How does it ensure the security of my personal and financial information? And what measures does the bank have in place to protect against hacking attempts?

I apologize for asking these questions, but it's important for me to have a clear understanding before moving forward. Thank you for your understanding.

Best wishes,
Judith

subject: Re: What Do You Want?
body:
Dear James Mordi,

Thank you for reaching out and sharing your concerns about the encryption technology used by the bank. I understand that you are not well-versed in banking matters, but I can assure you that banks take the security of their customers' personal and financial information very seriously.

To explain how encryption technology works, it essentially involves encoding data in such a way that only authorized individuals or systems can access and decipher it. This ensures that even if someone were to intercept the data, they would not be able to make sense of it without the proper decryption key.

In terms of protecting against hacking attempts, banks employ multiple layers of security measures. These can include firewalls, intrusion detection systems, regular security audits, and constant monitoring of network activity. Additionally, banks often have dedicated teams that specialize in cybersecurity to stay ahead of potential threats.

Regarding Mr. Gilbertha's experience with this encryption technology, it's great to hear that he had a successful run with it. However, it's important to note that individual experiences may vary and it's always wise to exercise caution when dealing with financial matters.

If you have any specific questions or concerns about the encryption technology or any other aspect of the bank's security measures, please feel free to ask. I'm here to help!

Best wishes,
Judith
